newsitem.title: CHINA: China participation hopes boost Hopewell.
newsitem.headline: China participation hopes boost Hopewell.

text.p: Shares of Hopewell Holdings Ltd rose on market talk that a Chinese partner might take a stake in the company, brokers said on Friday.
"Speculation that a major Chinese conglomerate is close to reaching an agreement to take a stake in Hopewell fueled demand for Hopewell," said a sales manager at regional brokerage.
Hopewell shares rose HK$0.20 or 4.23 percent to HK$4.925 in late trade on volume of 73.64 million shares.
Hopewell said in a statement issued through the stock exchange Friday afternoon that it was not aware of any reasons behind the recent surge in its shares' price and trading volume.
Brokers said a credit rating firm revising up Hopewell's outlook also aided buying.
Standard & Poor's earlier on Friday affirmed its BBB-minus corporate credit rating on Hopewell and revised the outlook to stable from negative.
